com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.util

Class TableDataUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.util.TableDataUtil

  • public class TableDataUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    The TableDataUtil class provides utility functions for working with table data objects.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(DataTable table)
        Get a "nice" string representation of a DataTable. The representation takes the form of an ascii table, described in AsciiTableWriter. Because this will create a representation of the entire table as text, it is not recommended to use this method on tables with large amounts of data.
        Parameters:
        table - The table.
        Returns:
        a string representation of table.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(DataTable table,
                        TextFormat... formats)
        Get a "nice" string representation of a DataTable. The representation takes the form of an ascii table, described in AsciiTableWriter. Because this will create a representation of the entire table as text, it is not recommended to use this method on tables with large amounts of data.
        Parameters:
        table - The table.
        formats - The formats to use for the columns in the table.
        Returns:
        a string representation of table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of formats in formats does not equal the number of columns in table.

      • asTable

        public static DataTable asTable(DataRow... rows)
        Return a series of DataRows as a DataTable. The returned table will be read only.
        Parameters:
        rows - The rows.
        Returns:
        a data table containing rows.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are no rows in rows, or if any one of the rows in rows is incompatible with another (i.e. has a different number of columns, or has a different data type for one of the columns).

      • asTable

        public static DataTable asTable(java.lang.Iterable<DataRow> rows)
        Return a series of DataRows as a DataTable. The returned table will be read only.
        Parameters:
        rows - The rows.
        Returns:
        a data table containing rows.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are no rows in rows, or if any one of the rows in rows is incompatible with another (i.e. has a different number of columns, or has a different data type for one of the columns).

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Iterable<DataRow> rows)
        Get a "nice" string representation of a series of DataRows. The representation takes the form of an ascii table, described in AsciiTableWriter. Because this will create a representation of the rows as text, it is not recommended to use this method on large numbers of rows.
        Parameters:
        rows - The rows.
        Returns:
        a string representation of table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are no rows in rows, or if any one of the rows in rows is incompatible with another (i.e. has a different number of columns, or has an incompatible data type for one of the columns).

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Iterable<DataRow> rows,
                        TextFormat... formats)
        Get a "nice" string representation of a series of DataRows. The representation takes the form of an ascii table, described in AsciiTableWriter. Because this will create a representation of the rows as text, it is not recommended to use this method on large numbers of rows
        Parameters:
        rows - The rows.
        formats - The formats to use for the row entries
        Returns:
        a string representation of table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of formats in formats does not equal the number of columns in each row in rows, if there are no row in rows, or if any one of the rows in rows is incompatible with another (i.e. has a different number of columns, or has an incompatible data type for one of the columns).
